issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Found this in the stress test,

The backing volume for ebs backed instance goes to {{available}} state for couple of seconds after the instance is terminated.

{noformat}
[2013-10-05 22:02:02,336] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Instance(i-F0FA3E00) State(shutting-down), elapsed:646/800
[2013-10-05 22:02:13,160] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Instance(i-F0FA3E00) State(terminated) time elapsed (657)
[2013-10-05 22:02:13,160] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: Instance:i-F0FA3E00 is now in terminated
[2013-10-05 22:02:13,161] [i-F0FA3E00] [DEBUG]: volume:vol-DADE4100/in-use, from BDM, D.O.T.:True, waiting on status:deleted, elapsed:0/180
[2013-10-05 22:02:14,068] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:2170)Starting method: get_volumes(self, volume_id=vol-DADE4100, status=None, attached_instance=None, attached_dev=None, snapid=None, zone=None, filters=None, minsize=1, maxsize=None, md5=None, eof=False)
[2013-10-05 22:02:28,922] [i-F0FA3E00] [DEBUG]: volume:vol-DADE4100/available, from BDM, D.O.T.:True, waiting on status:deleted, elapsed:15/180
[2013-10-05 22:02:29,834] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:2170)Starting method: get_volumes(self, volume_id=vol-DADE4100, status=None, attached_instance=None, attached_dev=None, snapid=None, zone=None, filters=None, minsize=1, maxsize=None, md5=None, eof=False)
[2013-10-05 22:02:43,821] [i-F0FA3E00] [DEBUG]: volume:vol-DADE4100/available, from BDM, D.O.T.:True, waiting on status:deleted, elapsed:30/180
[2013-10-05 22:02:44,771] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:2170)Starting method: get_volumes(self, volume_id=vol-DADE4100, status=None, attached_instance=None, attached_dev=None, snapid=None, zone=None, filters=None, minsize=1, maxsize=None, md5=None, eof=False)
[2013-10-05 22:02:49,894] [i-F0FA3E00] [DEBUG]: i-F0FA3E00 terminated, vol-DADE4100/available: volume entered expected state:deleted
[2013-10-05 22:02:49,894] [i-F0FA3E00] [DEBUG]: Incorrect status for volume:vol-DADE4100, status:available
[101m
TESTUNIT FAILED: MyTestTraceback (most recent call last):
  File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eutester/eutestcase.py", line 275, in run
    ret = self.method()
  File "./test_script", line 41, in MyTest
    instance.terminate_and_verify(timeout=800)
  File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eutester/euinstance.py", line 724, in terminate_and_verify
    all_vols.remove(vol)
ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list
[0m
{noformat}

This is happening on for vmware cluster. The volume is removed from the cloud within couple of seconds,

{noformat}
[2013-10-05 22:02:51,756] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: clean_up_test_volumes starting, volumes:test_resources['volumes']
[2013-10-05 22:02:51,756] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 
--->(ec2ops.py:2170)Starting method: get_volumes(self, volume_id=vol-DADE4100, status=None, attached_instance=None, attached_dev=None, snapid=None, zone=None, filters=None, minsize=1, maxsize=None, md5=None, eof=True)
[2013-10-05 22:02:55,533] [EUCAOPS] [DEBUG]: 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Ignoring caught Exception:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eucaops/__init__.py", line 319, in clean_up_test_volumes
    vol = self.get_volume(volume_id=vol.id)
  File "/share/eutester-base/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eutester-0.0.7-py2.6.egg/eucaops/ec2ops.py", line 2263, in get_volume
    raise e
Exception: Unable to find matching volume

vol-DADE4100, Could not retrieve volume, may no longer exist?
{noformat}
fields.summary: root device becomes available for a while after the instance is terminated in vmware

comments.body: This ticket relates to VMware. See https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility for latest hypervisor compatibility by version.
